abstract: Youth courts do more than simply divert teenagers from juvenile justice: they actively create pro-social behavior.
snippet: Youth courts do more than simply divert teenagers from juvenile justice: they actively create pro-social behavior.
lead_paragraph: On Friday, Fixes examined the Youth Court of the District of Columbia, a forum where first-time nonviolent teenage offenders are judged by others who have been in the same situation.   The D.C. Youth Court is one of the largest of some 1,000 youth courts around the country.   These courts are designed to help minor offenders avoid a criminal record and stay out of juvenile justice - traditionally an efficient production line for criminality.

headline.main: Where Teenagers Find the Jury Isn't Rigged
